article.headline: Albany, N.Y. 66, UMBC 63
article.story: BALTIMORE -- Logan Aronhalt scored 28 points and Tim Ambrose had 25 as Albany (N.Y.) overcame a 15-point deficit to defeat Maryland-Baltimore County 66-63 on Wednesday night. The Great Danes (11-12, 4-4 America East Conference) trailed 37-22 with 2:16 left in the first half and 39-27 at the break. The Retrievers (3-18, 2-6) still led 49-36 with 14:24 to go when Albany went on a 14-2 run to get within a point. The Great Danes tied it at 55 on an Ambrose 3-pointer with 7:47 left, but didn't pull ahead until Mike Black's layup made it 64-63 with 23 seconds left. Chris De La Rosa, who led the Retrievers with 15 points, missed a jumper with 7 seconds to go and Albany's John Puk rebounded. Aronhalt's two free throws with 2 seconds left gave the Great Danes their third straight win. Albany shot 38.5 percent from the field (25 of 65) while UMBC shot 39.7 percent (25 of 63).

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
